content:
While searching the spec for a ValeSet that contains all 2-letter ISO country codes, I found only this: http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/valueset-jurisdiction.html
The term "jurisdiction" seems very use case specific for such a generic set. Shouldn't there be a ValueSet of all ISO codes for use in any context that requires a binding to this code system, like for Profiling Address.country ? I'd be hesitant to create an identical ValueSet to profile Address but using one that's calles "jurisdiction" feels strange, too.
It's not only countries - it's also provinces, states, territories and other geopolicial regions

ok yes, I see it.
We want to bind Address.country to ISO-2-letter codes for the German profiles, but it feels weird to create a ValueSet in our realm.
Shouldn't there be a standard ValueSet for ISO-codes that we could refer to?
yes it would make sense for us to define that for everyone
Change request? (And if you want to attach the value set definition with it, that'd be welcome :>)
